speaker: User
message: Valliappan : Hi, I am a Year 4 SOA student. I am searching for an academic article for goodwill and IFRS accounting

speaker: User
message: Valliappan : I am confused as to what is practitioner and what is an academic article

speaker: User
message: Valliappan : My team needs to find 1 practitioner and 1 academic article each. We have already found the practitioner one. Hence, We need to find an academic research article to summarise and write for our report.

speaker: User
message: Valliappan : Now I understand the difference clearly, thank you! :)

speaker: User
message: Valliappan : Thanks for the articles. I will research more on these type of articles

speaker: User
message: Valliappan : Thank you! You too have a good day :)

speaker: Help Desk
message: [name1] : Sure, what I can do is to help you identify what an academic article looks like. Before that, may I find out further why you need to differentiate btw a practitioner and academic article

speaker: Help Desk
message: [name1] : (provides information about practitioner and academic articles)

speaker: Help Desk
message: [name1] : let me find some examples. Usually an academic article is published in something called academic journals, e.g. Journal of Accounting Research

speaker: Help Desk
message: [name1] : articles in this journal are all academic articles. They often have a journal name, volume, issue and page number, and a lot of times a DOI

speaker: Help Desk
message: [name1] : this is one example academic accounting article

speaker: Help Desk
message: [name1] : no problem! let us know if you need any further help

speaker: Help Desk
message: [name1] : Sure, just reach out to us again if you need help. Have a good day!
